content:
...I just noticed that (on a vanilla installation of Backdrop) when previewing content, there's an option for a "Tokens" display mode:
Screen-Shot-2020-07-26-at-1.14.45-am.png

...I've never used that, but the thing is that it is disabled (or "not customized"):
Screen-Shot-2020-07-26-at-1.19.34-am.png
...has anyone used this display? ...and should it be shown as an option if disabled?
I believe that this display mode comes from token, and can be used as described here: https://www.drupal.org/node/1299662
...I just never had use for it.
We added that display mode back in recently. It was missing from token.

Sure @Herb ...no objections there. Just wanted to say that:
a) never used or noticed it before, so I'm unsure as to in which use cases it's needed
b) noticed that this display is disabled, yet shown in the drop-down as an option.
When it's disabled it uses the default. It's so you can display tokens differently than the default if that's what people want
